business.headline: Loan fraud case: ED issues lookout notice against Anil AmbaniA lookout circular has been issued against Anil Ambani at the request of the Enforcement Directorate (ED), preventing him from travelling abroad without court permission.

Anil Ambani faces lookout notice in Rs 3,000-crore loan fraud caseAnil Ambani can now no longer travel outside India without court permission. This comes after a series of crackdowns on his business entities, allegations of fraud against his firms, and a summons issued by a federal agency.
Vandana Vasudevan on how tech is reshaping daily lifeSpeaking with Business Today's Sakshi Batra, OTP Please author Vandana Vasudevan explains how this shift is changing daily routines.

OTP Please! The double-edged sword of digital living: Vandana VasudevanSpeaking with Business Today's Sakshi Batra, OTP Please author Vandana Vasudevan tells how tech has changed how we live, making travel easier for the disabled, food more accessible, and work more flexible. But she warns of fading community bonds, unhealthy habits, and insecure gig jobs. Tech must support life, not replace human connection.

US tariffs will not have significant adverse impact on Indian economy: SourcesThe 25% tariff announced by US President Donald Trump will not have a significant adverse impact on the Indian economy, government sources said.

Elon Musk's Starlink to operate soon in India. Check monthly plansUnion Telecom Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia confirmed that Starlink has been awarded a Unified Licence to launch its satellite internet operations in India.
Sensex closes 586 points lower, Nifty below 25,600; Infosys ends 3% downThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 585.67 points to close at 80,599.91, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 203 points to end at 24,565.35.

CA explains why you should not use FDs as an emergency fundAccording to RBI guidelines, banks can charge up to 0.5% to 1.0% of the interest rate as a penalty if FDs are broken before their maturity period.

Indian interests top priority, no chance of compromising due to US tariffs: SourcesAn official said that the government is closely watching the developments but sees no reason for alarm after the US imposed a 25% tariff on India.

Jane Street not cooperating in probe with income tax department: ReportThe firm's servers are located outside India, and officials said they are unable to access them. Additionally, accounts books are also being maintained overseas, even though company law requires them to be kept in India.

Planning to buy a car without taking loan? Here's how you can do itThink you need a big salary or bank loan to own a car? Think again. A thoughtful plan, regular savings, and side gigs helped one man save Rs 7.1 lakh in three years, all without borrowing a rupee. Here's how you can do it too.

Explained: Why PNB Housing Finance Ltd shares crashed 18% todayPNB Housing Finance Ltd share crash: The steep fall followed days of weak performance. Over the past five days, the stock has lost 19.59%, and in the last month, it has dropped 26.53%.

entertainment.headline: Tom Holland returns as Spider-Man in 'Brand New Day', first look at new suitTom Holland returns in Spider-Man: Brand New Day. Sony teases a new suit, real-world filming in Glasgow, and direction by Shang-Chi's Destin Daniel Cretton.

Overwhelmed SRK calls National Award responsibility to show truth, not finishing lineActor Shah Rukh Khan wrote a heartfelt note on winning the Best Actor in a Leading Role Award for 'Jawan' at the 71st National Film Awards. He shared the award with actor Vikrant Massey.

Kim Kardashian reacts to Anthony Hopkins Hanibal spoof of her face wrap brandActor Anthony Hopkins humorously wore a SKIMS face wrap resembling his Hannibal Lecter mask. He joked about feeling younger in the viral video.

Shilpa Rao thanks Shah Rukh Khan, Anirudh as she wins National Award for ChaleyaSinger Shilpa Rao thanked actor Shah Rukh Khan after winning the Best Playback Singer Award at the 71st National Award. She won the award for the romantic track - 'Chaleya' from 'Jawan'.

Janki Bodiwala dedicates National Award to team Vash, calls director her godJanki Bodiwala won the Best Supporting Actor award at the 71st National Film Awards for her impactful role in the Gujarati film 'Vash', marking a major milestone in her career. She shared the honour with Malayalam actor Urvashi and hopes this win will inspire more female-led stories in regional cinema.

Vikrant Massey dedicates National Award to marginalised, lucky sharing it with SRKVikrant Massey has won his first National Award for his powerful role in the film '12th Fail'. He expressed heartfelt gratitude and dedicated the honour to marginalised people.

The Kerala Story's Sudipto Sen reacts to Best Director win at National AwardsSudipto Sen won the Best Director for 'The Kerala Story' at the 71st National Film Awards. The film's portrayal of ISIS recruitment sparked debate but gained widespread public support.

Rajinikanth's Coolie gets A certificate ahead of August 14 releaseRajinikanth's upcoming film 'Coolie', directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, earned an A certificate. Featuring a stellar cast and Aamir Khan's special cameo, the film is highly anticipated for its high-octane sequences and will release on August 14 in multiple languages.

Rani Mukerji calls her first National Award as Best Actress deeply personalRani Mukerji won her first National Award for 'Mrs Chatterjee vs Norway' after 30 years in films. She dedicated the award to all mothers and thanked her fans for their love and support.

Tehran trailer: John Abraham battles enemies across borders in action-packed dramaJohn Abraham's upcoming film 'Tehran' is a gripping spy thriller inspired by real events, with a trailer that teases intense action, political drama, and a high-stakes mission. The film, co-starring Manushi Chhillar, will premiere on Zee5 on August 14.

71st National Film Awards: Best Actor, Best Film and more. Full winners' list hereThe 71st National Film Awards were announced in New Delhi, honouring excellence across Indian cinema with Shah Rukh Khan and Vikrant Massey sharing Best Actor and Rani Mukerji winning Best Actress. Check out the full winners' list here.

Vikrant Massey-SRK share National Award for Best Actor, Rani Mukerji wins Best ActressVikrant Massey and Shah Rukh Khan won Best Actor for '12th Fail' and 'Jawan' respectively at the 71st National Film Awards. Rani Mukerji bagged Best Actress for her role in 'Mrs Chatterjee vs Norway'.

Sanya Malhotra's Kathal wins Best Hindi Feature at National Film Awards 2025'Kathal: A Jackfruit Mystery' won Best Hindi Feature at the 71st National Film Awards, announced on August 1. The film was praised for its unique storytelling, strong performances, and socially relevant message.

Janhvi Kapoor-Ishaan Khatter's Homebound to close Indian Film Festival of MelbourneAfter a successful premiere at Cannes, 'Homebound' starring Ishaan Khatter, Vishal Jethwa, and Janhvi Kapoor will close the Indian Film Festival of Melbourne (IFFM) 2025. Directed by Neeraj Ghaywan, the film explores friendship, ambition, and the emotional cost of change.

After Sikandar failure, AR Murugadoss says mother-tongue films tap his potentialDirector AR Murugadoss highlights the importance of making films in one's mother-tongue, citing challenges in translating cultural nuances and emotions when working with other languages. His statement comes after the failure of Salman Khan's 'Sikandar'.

WWE Unreal review: Netflix docuseries reveals real drama behind wrestling spectacleRelease Date:Tue Jul 29, 2025'WWE: Unreal' docuseries gives fans a sneak peek into the process, raw emotions and the life of each wrestler. The documentary hits a home run in humanising the world of pro-wrestling for its fans.

Dhadak 2 X reviews: Fans call Triptii-Siddhant's film an unworthy remake'Dhadak 2', starring Triptii Dimri and Siddhant Chaturvedi, released in theatres today and sparked mixed reactions online. While some praised its raw portrayal of caste and love, others criticised it as a weak remake of the Tamil original 'Pariyerum Perumal'.

Hrithik Roshan invites fans for Aavan Jaavan dance contest ahead of War 2 releaseActor Hrithik Roshan has launched a global dance contest for the 'War 2' song 'Aavan Jaavan'. He shared a video , inviting fans worldwide to join and win exciting prizes, ahead of the film's release.

Was dating Aadar Jain a mistake? Tara Sutaria shares details and new loveActor Tara Sutaria shared that she's in a happy place in life and reflected on the missteps she made in her twenties, subtly referencing a past relationship.

general news.headline: Trump sends nuclear submarines near Russia after Putin aide's 'dead hand' threatUS President Trump announced on social media that two nuclear submarines have been deployed near Russia in response to foolish and inflammatory statements by Dimitry Medvedev.

Caught on camera: Man slaps fellow passenger having panic attack on IndiGo flightIn the video, the man was seen slapping the passenger unprovoked. The man having a panic attack was being helped by air hostesses when he was suddenly slapped by the accused.

What India said on White House's call for Nobel Peace Prize for TrumpWhite House has claimed that the global peace deals brokered by Trump average to one per month and has reiterated the call for the Nobel Peace Prize to be awarded to the US President.

Lion-hearted Siraj, brave Jaiswal inspire Indian fightback in spicy Oval TestIndia vs England, 5th Test: Mohammed Siraj and Prasidh Krishna's efforts with the ball and Yashasvi Jaiswal's brisk second-innings fifty helped India overcome a poor morning session and edge ahead in a thrilling Test at Oval in London.

Story of the crash of Flight AI 171 and a very flighty investigative reportThe Boeing 787 Dreamliner, which was on its way to London, crashed into the BJ Medical College hostel building in Ahmedabad within minutes of take-off on June 12. The tragedy left 260 people dead. Within a month of the AAIB's preliminary investigation report on the crash appearing to have settled blame on the cockpit crew, a veteran pilot shattered the silence with a striking analysis that turned the investigation on its head.

Gunfight underway with 3 TRF terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir's KulgamA joint operation by the Indian Army, CRPF and Jammu and Kashmir Police is presently underway at Kulgam in Jammu and Kashmir to neutralise the terrorists.

Vikrant Massey-SRK share National Award for Best Actor, Rani Mukerji wins Best ActressVikrant Massey and Shah Rukh Khan won Best Actor for '12th Fail' and 'Jawan' respectively at the 71st National Film Awards. Rani Mukerji bagged Best Actress for her role in 'Mrs Chatterjee vs Norway'.

From the India Today archives (2025) | Trumping Donald: India's bold new deal with USWith the US administration slapping a 25 per cent tariff on certain Indian exports from August 1, will PM Modi's high-risk gambit with Trump pay off?

Engines dead, pilots glided plane for 120km over ocean, saved 306 livesWhen both engines of Transat Flight 236 from Canada to Portugal died out midair over the Atlantic Ocean in 2001 due to a fuel leak, it was still 120km short of an airstrip. The pilots glided the plane to safety, creating a world record and saving 306 people onboard, in what is now known as the Miracle on the Azores.
Flipkart Freedom Sale: Tablets Get Their Biggest Price Drop of the YearFor buyers looking to invest in a new device, this could be the best chance before the festive season arrives.

Anil Ambani faces lookout notice in Rs 3,000-crore loan fraud caseAnil Ambani can now no longer travel outside India without court permission. This comes after a series of crackdowns on his business entities, allegations of fraud against his firms, and a summons issued by a federal agency.

'Sink city' Gurugram: Who is responsible for Millennium City's civic mess?This India Today special campaign for change focusses on the civic collapse in Gurgaon, the Millennium City. Residents, who have invested significantly in luxury properties, find themselves navigating a city plagued by infrastructural failure, especially during monsoons.

SpaceX launches Crew-11 astronauts on six-month mission to spaceThe Crew-11 mission ferried four astronauts to the International Space Station (ISS) for a science and technology expedition. The crew includes Nasa astronauts Zena Cardman and Mike Fincke, Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency (JAXA) astronaut Kimiya Yui, and Roscosmos cosmonaut Oleg Platonov.

The Real Anand: The Pain Behind Kishore Kumar's MadnessKishore Kumar's eccentricities revealed a paradoxical genius whose soulful voice illuminated millions, masking a life of solitude and inner turmoil.
Even the phone felt very heavy: Shux on readjusting to life on EarthHe vividly recalled the moment he asked for his phone after landing, and was surprised by how heavy it felt in his hand.

US bans Karachi hotel visits for staff after threat, issues security alertThe US restricts official visits to Karachi's high-end hotels after a reported threat, amid heightened travel advisories and persistent terrorism risks across Pakistan's volatile security landscape.

71st National Film Awards: Best Actor, Best Film and more. Full winners' list hereThe 71st National Film Awards were announced in New Delhi, honouring excellence across Indian cinema with Shah Rukh Khan and Vikrant Massey sharing Best Actor and Rani Mukerji winning Best Actress. Check out the full winners' list here.

Dubious: India junks UK report on 'targeting' Khalistanis, political opponentsThe sources cited in the UK Joint Committee report include claims made by 'Sikhs for Justice,' a US-based group advocating for the creation of a separate Khalistan state, which has been banned by India under its anti-terror law, the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA).

Islamist outfit issued 'Greater Bangladesh' map with Indian areas? Here's the factOver three months after a controversial map showing a so-called "Greater Bangladesh" with parts of India and Myanmar was displayed at Dhaka University, the MEA has reacted to the reports. An outfit, Sultanat-e-Bangla, was said to be behind the map. However, the MEA said Bangladesh's official fact-check unit found no such group active in the country, and the map was part of a history exhibition.

Luxury flats, prime properties: Vigilance raid uncovers Odisha engineer's empireA raid on a Bhubaneswar engineer led to the discovery of two four-storey buildings, seven flats, four commercial properties and nine high-value plots in and around the city.

How safety, dignity worries keep Indian women out of work"Urban infra to workplaces, it's all designed by men for men," says Pooja Sharma Goyal, CEO of Udaiti Foundation, whose survey of blue-grey collar workers threw up grim stats

Rats spotted on ingredient trays at Lucknow sweet shop, video sparks outrageThe now-viral reel shows the behind-the-scenes process of making the traditional delicacy. However, midway through the video, rats can be seen running across trays of ingredients.

Want us to keep quiet? Watch KL Rahul argue with umpire to back Prasidh vs RootIndia vs England: Day 2 of the final Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy Test saw intense sledging between Indian fast bowlers and England players. KL Rahul argued with umpire Kumar Dharmasena, who was seen warning Prasidh Krishna for a verbal duel with Joe Root.

Raids on ex-Karnataka clerk unearth Rs 30 crore in assets, including 24 housesA former clerk at Karnataka Rural Infrastructure Development Limited is under investigation after a Lokayukta raid revealed massive wealth, including houses, land and jewellery, worth over Rs 30 crore.

Tom Holland returns as Spider-Man in 'Brand New Day', first look at new suitTom Holland returns in Spider-Man: Brand New Day. Sony teases a new suit, real-world filming in Glasgow, and direction by Shang-Chi's Destin Daniel Cretton.

KL Rahul argued with umpire Kumar Dharmasena, who was seen warning Prasidh Krishna for a verbal duel with Joe Root.

Pakistan, Afghanistan, UAE to play T20I tri-series to prepare for Asia CupPakistan, Afghanistan, and the UAE will play a T20I tri-series in Sharjah from August 29 to September 7, 2025. Each team plays the others twice in a double round-robin, with the top two meeting in the final on September.

Siraj earns praise for fiery Oval spell: His heart is bigger than anyone else'sEngland vs India, 5th Test: Mohammed Siraj delivered a fiery bowling spell to lead India's comeback in the final Test at The Oval. Siraj bowled eight overs in a gritty post-lunch session on Day 2 in London.

Did India rest Jasprit Bumrah from Oval Test with Asia Cup as bigger priority?ENG vs IND: India has released Jasprit Bumrah from the squad ahead of the fifth and final Test at The Kennington Oval in London. According to a BCCI source, the decision was made with an eye on managing his workload, as Bumrah is expected to feature in the upcoming Asia Cup.

New Zealand wipe out Zimbabwe in 1st Test, take 1-0 series leadZIM vs NZ: New Zealand secured a 1-0 lead in the series after beating Zimbabwe by nine wickets in the opening game at the  Queens Sports Club in Bulawayo.

Oval Test: Nice guy Joe Root loses his cool after verbal volley with Prasidh KrishnaEngland vs India, 5th Test: Joe Root lost his cool after fast bowler Prasidh Krishna sledged him during the second session on Day 2. The Indian bowlers were fired up after being taken to the cleaners in the first session on Friday.

Unnecessary? Aakash Deep faces flak for send-off to Ben Duckett in Oval TestIndia fast bowler Akash Deep is facing flak for making unnecessary physical contact with England batter Ben Duckett after dismissing him on Day 2 of the fifth Test against England at the Oval.

34 balls, 6 runs, 4 wickets: India's lower-order blown away on Day 2 morningEngland needed just 34 balls to dismantle the remaining four Indian wickets on a lively second morning at The Oval, bundling the visitors out for a modest 224 — the lowest first-innings total of the series so far.

Jasprit Bumrah released from India squad during final Test at The OvalIndia's pace spearhead Jasprit Bumrah has been officially released from the squad for the fifth and final Test of the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy against England at The Oval, as part of a pre-determined workload management plan.

Oval Test: Nice guy Joe Root loses his cool after verbal volley with Prasidh KrishnaEngland vs India, 5th Test: Joe Root lost his cool after fast bowler Prasidh Krishna sledged him during the second session on Day 2. The Indian bowlers were fired up after being taken to the cleaners in the first session on Friday.

34 balls, 6 runs, 4 wickets: India's lower-order blown away on Day 2 morningEngland needed just 34 balls to dismantle the remaining four Indian wickets on a lively second morning at The Oval, bundling the visitors out for a modest 224 — the lowest first-innings total of the series so far.

Jasprit Bumrah released from India squad during final Test at The OvalIndia's pace spearhead Jasprit Bumrah has been officially released from the squad for the fifth and final Test of the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy against England at The Oval, as part of a pre-determined workload management plan.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
